content.body: Heh. So Flyglobespan went bust earlier this month.
was a bit worried about whether they would go bust when he flew back from TPAC last year
So, Hixie's birthday has come.
And time for me to reveal what I've been working on for the past week.
http://stuff.gsnedders.com/whatwg/vocabs.html
Take a look at the xref there :)
Though there does appear to be some bugs.
fixes wha looks to be the biggest bug
(Tell me about bugs in xref, bugs such as lack of TOC and substitutions are known issue)
foolip: yt?
gsnedders: on and off
foolip: What do you mean by references to multipage?
foolip: From where? Within the spec?
foolip: Another document?
gsnedders: I mean references from e.g. the vocabs spec to the multipage HTML5 spec
as opening the single-page spec will kill a certain web browser
Web browsers should suck less. :)
glares at Hixie for going to the extreme when demonstrating the variety of syntax HTML5 can have.
<VIdeO autoBUFFER="AUTObuffer" autoplay CONTRols=''         ></VIDEO>
yeah
see the second example for <section>
should have used some tabs and newlines in the whitespace, too
Haha.
That's painful.
On another note, what is the point of <dfn>?
Isn't it one of those elements that's pretty stupid but not quite stupid enough to remove given that it was in previous versions of the standard?
Probably
but I was hoping for a more specific answer :P
GPHemsley: Look at all the cases of dfn in the spec :)
GPHemsley: It can be used to build xrefs
tries regenning spec with the next revision of Anolis 2
But it can't be used to substitute for an <abbr> @title
Why not?
Uploading the spec is slow.
gsnedders: Because (based on how I'm reading the spec) you have specify the @title for each <abbr>, regardless of whether you've previously <dfn>'d it.
http://stuff.gsnedders.com/whatwg/vocabs.html --- it has the date (again)!
(Sorry, I just added a brand-new sub implementation into Anolis 2, which is a lot quicker than before)
gsnedders: Do you have to specify all the source files at once to get x-doc x-refs?
jgraham: You can either do that or you can specific URLs to load dfns from
Hixie: Happy Birthday, as I understand it
(But only those with @id, as it can't add them in that case)
gsnedders: Right so if someone wants to reference HTML5 without having access to the source document, it should work
jgraham: Yeah.
(for example)
gsnedders: Nice :)
has the advantage of having the source documents
jgraham: It can't so well cope with docs that reference each other both ways without the source files, for obvious reasons
jgraham: Also, I guess you'll be pleased to know that Anolis 2 should be a lot cheaper than 1
Boxing day sales?
jgraham: Also I want to discuss one or two API related things about it with you, but probably won't do that until I'm back in Sweden
jgraham: You know what I mean :)
gsnedders: Sure. Probaably better to discuss then ince I am on dody hotel wifi at the mment
(which I blame for all the mising characters)
(because doing corrections is to painful)
Also I don't have to deal with silly textual mediums, but can instead just speak :P
Indeed
(TOC I think is the main thing, apart from any actual UI, that remains to be done)
jgraham: Write your lines in a local text editor then copy-and-paste into your IRC client
Which validator (w3.org or validator.nu) is usually more up-to-date with the spec?
Philip`: No
for html5lib: should I use the release version (.11) or the tip of the hg repo?
that means: is the head of the repo stable?
quesada: More so than 0.1
(So use it)
GPHemsley: validator.nu
GPHemsley: It's the same impl, but v.nu is maintained by the guy who wrote the impl, so normally haschanges pushed to it more quickly
jgraham: does test_tests14_2_lxml fail for you?
jgraham: Leading to four failures?
(in total)
gsnedders: K, thanks.
actually, the qa-dev version of the W3C might sometimes be more up to date thanks to MikeSmith
hello whatwg
gsnedders: wow, dude, that's fantastic
gsnedders: i'd offer to marry you, but i'm already engaged
happy b-day Hixie
thanks
happy birthday
the xref stuff looks pretty neat
maybe I should start using that too
i am so going to be all over that
http://on2.com/index.php?id=472&news_id=696
is that standard for corporate bylaws?
(that merger approval requires majority of shares outstanding, not just voted)
no idea
wow, On2 is practically a penny stock
I've never seen anything like this before, but then I never pay much attention to mergers
still somewhat below what you'd get in the exchange if the merger is approved
I think part of the issue is that the stock used to be worth USD 20
most mergers you hear about, a large proportion of the shares are held by institutional investors who always vote their proxy
30 even, at its high in 2000
the highest price I see in the past 5 years is $3
they have been losing money for some time
gsnedders: Haven't checked but if that is the test I think it is then yes
(I guess the magic infoset coercion thing isn't quite working right)
(so it doesn't see the right tag name on the stack)
